hackathon-description-text: YHack is a national hackathon hosted by and at Yale University. Join over 1500 undergraduate and high school students for a weekend of hacking. It's the perfect opportunity to meet and learn from other like-minded hackers, all the while honing your own skills. Create a mobile app to stop world hunger, learn the hottest new javascript frameworks, implement a hardware hack that revolutionizes the wearables industry... or just do something for the lulz.
hackathon-rules:
Prize winners are strictly limited to those who submit a hack at the end of the hacking period, and then go on to present that hack at the YHack science fair!
Teams have a maximum size of 4 people.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Apple Watch for each team member
Surface Pro 3 for each team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of PayPal, Braintree, or Venmo
Best Use of Hewlett Packard Developer API (Grand Prize)
Best Use of Hewlett Packard Developer API (2nd place)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Vacation Package to anywhere JetBlue flies. 2 hotel rooms + 4 plane tickets, 4 nights
4 plane tickets (round-trip) to anywhere JetBlue flies
Vacation Package to anywhere JetBlue flies. 2 hotel rooms + 4 plane tickets, 4 nights
4 plane tickets (round-trip) to anywhere JetBlue flies
Amazon Gift Cards, Mongo DB Swag, chance to win trip for 4 to NYC for mongodb world 2016

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of NLU (Natural Language Understanding) API
Innovative Use of Speech (Runner Up) Nuance

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: DJI Phantom 3 Standard per team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: USAA - Best solution that meets a need of a US Military service member, a veteran or their families.
Best application with source code smaller than 4k bytes (Datto)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 Amazon Gift Card for the team + Round trip flights and hotel to Menlo Park for the Facebook Hackathon Finals for each team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best project in service of a charitable cause or humanitarian effort (Bloomberg)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $3000 cash, Gunnar Glasses per team member, Estimote iBeacon Kit per team member, Pebble Steel per team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Yale API (Yale ITS)
Best Cultural Heritage Hack (Yale Institute of Cultural Heritage)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=70 Tower Pkwy Payne Whitney Gymnasium, New Haven, CT 06511, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: We like hacks that define and remedy problems in a way that we've never seen before.
The project will be judged on how technical it was to implement.
What you thought about this project in relation to the others.

hackathon-location-address: 70 Tower Pkwy Payne Whitney Gymnasium, New Haven, CT 06511, USA
hackathon-description-header: YHack 2015 is the third iteration of Yale's premiere hackathon. For 36 hours, 1500 of the best hackers will converge at Yale University to compete for over $15,000 in prizes.
